title: What are the minimum cut off's for BA (hons.) English for various universities all over India? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ll try to answer your question because I was embroiled in a dilemma quite similar to this, the previous year. I wanted to pursue a degree in English from a reputable college in India. Enough said. I took on the task of researching some of the best institutes in the country for the same and the results were narrowed down to the following colleges- Lady Shri Ram College, Delhi UniversitySt. Stephen’s College, Delhi UniversitySt. Xavier’s College, MumbaiFergusson College, PuneChrist University, BangaloreSymbiosis School of Liberal Arts, PuneMy top ranked choices, LSR and Stephen’s, were the most difficult to get into, owing to the admission criteria which solely depends upon the sky-high (literally) ‘cutoffs’. Anything below a 95 in your Boards wouldn't work for LSR and Stephen’s would set the bar higher with more than a 97%. The good thing is, there is no dearth of excellent institutions in our country. If your 12th Grade marks fall short of these astronomically high marks, try your luck in the other colleges from the aforementioned. Christ University and Symbiosis, Pune have their own entrance examinations and interview which is a more holistic admission process. Good Luck!

Your 12th board marks will only help you to get in the universities like Delhi University(With over 70+ colleges) and Lucknow university. I suggest you to go with DU as it will be beneficial to you for your life goals. For DU,you've to score well as there isn't any other option available. Rest you can prepare for the entrance exams of the various universities like Banaras Hindu University,Aligarh University,Allahabad University and other state universities. Good Luck to you!!
